column1: length, 138kph and speared in to hit the pads as Roy moves into line, there's a half-hearted lbw appeal but it looks a touch high and leg side

got him, slashed to point - Roy goes second ball! Full and quite wide but there was swing for Hazlewood and Roy was reaching for a loose drive without having got his bearings, Smith snaffles the low catch and Australia have nipped out an early one again
pitched up in the channel, shaping away a touch as Hales shuffles into line and lets it go
length, 138kph on a fourth-fifth stump line, Hales shows it the maker's name in defence
tapped into the off side coming across
short and wide, Hales throws the bat and misses... not far off feathering through, from the looks of it, but the umpire decides Hazlewood should bowl that one again
fullish outside off, leans into a punch wide of mid-off and they trot through for the first run off the bat
good length in the channel, trying to tempt something rash from Hales, who's happy to remain circumspect
tighter to the stumps and patted towards extra cover
fired in straighter, 143kph on middle stumps, Hales chops down and gets another single through midwicket
ooh, hit high on the leg, whirring back in at him on the crease
good length, rising on off stump, Bairstow lines this up in defence
touch fuller, moves across and taps into the off side
coming back in and driven on the up, picks out cover
slightly short and wide and Hales rocks back to chop the ball down to third man
length delivery around off stump, YJB prods it away
full, Test-match length and looking for some nibble, Bairstow leans into a square punch but doesn't get it through
fired in on the stumps, 136kph/84mph and bunted towards mid-on
tight stuff so far from Hazlewood, giving up nothing for free, steered towards point
Cummins trundles in, hits a good length and Hales defends

bowled 'im! Superb ball from Cummins and England are two down for spit! There's been some nip off this fresh surface and Cummins locates the perfect length, it jags back appreciably as Hales presses forwards, flicks the front pad before rattling the off pole
fired in straight, Root gets well across and blocks
length, 142kph and rising up over off stump as Root shows it a straight bat
touch fuller, skidding on as Root hangs back but lines it up well to block
heat from Patty C, 145kph around the line of off, prodded into the covers but there's no run there - wicket maiden, Australia have grabbed England by the lapels this avo
on the stumps, Bairstow watches it under his nose and defends

pitched up, finds the outside edge - another one goes! England are tottering like aunty on the gin... Hazlewood went wide on the crease and slid the ball in, enticing the drive but there was just enough seam movement to shift the line and kiss the edge of the bat. Bairstow slopes off in the fifth over for a nine-ball duck
pitched up on off stump, solid forward press in defence
staying over the wicket, 141kph and pushed across as Morgan gets into line and defends again
full, gives him a bit of room and Morgan gets the scoreboard moving again with a stab through the covers
pitched up in the channel, 137kph/85mph and he warily lets this one go
fourth-stump line, Root comes across and pushes the ball square
hammering a good length, Root continues to watch them on to the face of the bat

dug in, Root wafts at a pull, gets a big, ballooning top edge... and Hazlewood pockets the catch at fine leg! Root bags a duck and England are four down! Good pace and bounce, the bumper got too big for Root and he sent it right down the fielder's gullet. This could get ugly
pitched up and Morgan strokes a couple back past the bowler, neatly driven fine of mid-off
angled across outside off, lets the ball go
length ball, Morgan pushes short into the covers and loudly bellows 'No!'
length ball around off, Buttler defends

zips off a length, grazes the outside edge! ENGLAND ARE 8 FOR 5!!! (Or 5 for 8, if you're that sort...) Brilliant ball from Hazlewood, not too much fault with the batsman here: perfect length, seaming a fraction as Buttler felt for it in defence, flicks the bat and Paine swallows another!
searing short ball, climbing through as Moeen hangs back
angled across in the channel, lets this one go
length, on middle and leg, Moeen prods a little tentatively and it rolls of the inside edge through midwicket
short ball, Morgan pulls and splices it... but safely into a gap on the leg side and it bobbles through midwicket for another single - and England are into double-figures, hurrah!
pushed across the bows, Morgan reaches for a prod through cover point for one
back of a length, lets this one go
touch short, rising over off stump and Moeen dabs it down short towards cover, they hustle through for one more
oh, not far from a drag-on! Pitched up and Morgan wanted to drive, ends up thick-edging past his legs for a single
touch short of a length, left alone in the corridor
flying through, 141kph as Moeen stays back and shoulders arms
shout for lbw! Was there bat involved...? Australia decide not to review, Morgan was a little tucked up trying to drive. Hazlewood seems to indicate that he hit it, although replays suggest otherwise
skips down and attempts to hit Hazlewood off his length, comes off bat and thigh pad, loops short of the slips
oof, that's a good ball, 140kph and screeching through past the outside edge as he feels for it coming forward
squirted off the pads into the leg side for one more
back of a length, Moeen tries to punch the rising ball from the crease but mistimes it
short again, 135kph and prodded towards mid-off
dug in short - too short, and called wide on height
drops short, 141kph and Morgan swats it into the off side, no timing on the stroke
angled across on off, pushed into the covers
serious clicks from Cummins, 148kph and nibbling back to hit the inside edge before deflecting into Morgan's thigh. Yowch!
dug in short, 143kph and whistling through as Morgan ducks and covers
length, shaping away a fraction in the channel as Morgan leans out and sniffs the sea breeze
nearly a boundary! But no dice, England... Morgan steps into a straight drive but Warner hares after it and pulls the ball in just in front of the rope at long-off!
another inside edge as Morgan pushes at a drive! Pings away behind square on the leg side
line and length outside off, Moeen lets the ball go
good-length ball on the pads, 135kph and Moeen flicks through midwicket
shuffles into line and defends
length, Morgan attempts to drive on the up, comes off the inside half of the bat and rolls to mid-on
137kph on the hip and Morgan jabs it away to fine leg
starts on the money, good length around middle and off, Morgan shows it a respectful straight bat
full, 134kph and sliding across as Morgan skips out and flays a drive to cover, no timing on that
fuller, looking for some off-stump nibble, Morgan defends
ooh, beats the bat, Morgan again trying to whack one, looking for a boundary (and, to be fair, England could do with a couple) but done by the ball decking away just enough
full and driven towards mid-off, again not out of the middle
pitched up, 135kph and Morgan clips this smoothly coming forwards but straight to mid-off
length ball, touch leg side to start with and Moeen skims it to fine leg
full, outside off and driven, mistimed towards mid-off again
full, hit on the pads, Tye appeals loudly... leg side, I think. Some swing there, though, made Morgan look very uncomfortable
on the stumps and prodded away
pitched up, 134kph and swerving in late, Morgan has to jam the bat down late again, outside-edged towards gully

now he drops in a good short ball and Morgan has to fend it down in front of his fizzog... Decent first over from Tye, no release of the shackles for England, who are clanking along like a torture-chamber fetishist
wicket-to-wicket from MMarsh, tucked through square leg for one
length, comes across on off, dabbed down into the covers and they trot another single
plugging away around fourth stump, tapped into the off side
134kph in the channel, signs that this ball might be just quietening down a touch, Moeen defends
or maybe not... fullish outside off and Moeen is beaten having a big woolly woof at the drive
very full and a touch wide, squirted through point to the sweeper. Speaking of which...
full length outside off, pushed down the ground to mid-off
angled across, 133kph and Moeen steers the ball towards backwards point
WE HAVE A BOUNDARY, FOLKS! Pitched up and Moeen kitchen-sinks it through the covers, struck hard in front of square and gives the sweeper no chance... England flying
full outside off and Moeen lashes this in the air, just one this time to deep point
pushed across the lefty, Morgan steers one more through point
short ball, Moeen rocks back and crumps four more in front of deep midwicket! Meaty pull shot, finds the rope again. 'What me worry?' says Moeen's internal Alfred E Neuman
on the back foot, pulled calmly round the corner
tight line and length, blocked back down the pitch
pulled once again, not quite timed but placed effectively in front of square
opens the face, a glide out to point, looking for the angle but not quite beating the field
a half-cocked drive to mid-off. Placing the bat into the line of the ball
tapped back down the wicket
looped up from round the wicket, tapped into the leg side
forward and steered to cover
low full toss into the toes, clipped to mid-on
flicked to leg
eased down to long-on, Australia happy to tease England with singles it seems
stretching onto the front foot to defend
back of a length, width outside off stump, but slapped straight to point

banged in short, an ugly pull takes the top-edge, but falls safe! Plops in no-man's land at a conventional midwicket. The perils of getting over-funky with the field when the opposition are on the canvas
clipped off the hip
muscled into the gap at midwicket
inside edge, over the top of leg stump! Living dangerously...
rising onto the toes, punched back down the pitch to the bowler
worked into the gap at long-off
round the wicket, eased down the ground to bring up the fifty. Scenes!
swept urgently off leg stump, no real contact
dipping into the toes from round the wicket, awkward line to get away
more width outside off stump and slapped over the covers, this is good from Morgan, finding a means to battle back
another attempted sweep, gathered at backward square
outside off, a stab through third man
stretching forward to push back to the bowler
width outside off stump, worked to cover
down the track, meets the ball on the move outside off, looking for the single but nothing on offer
cramped for room on the pads, a touch of inswing to the left-hander
short and shovelled round the corner to deep midwicket
looped onto the legs, clipped square
tossed up, dips into the legs, tucked to midwicket
Morgan gives himself room for a slap, an under-edged drive dribbles to backward point
on the toes, worked into the gap at midwicket again
chopped hard out to deep cover
tossed up, and tapped down the ground
no room to free the arms
cut out to point

short, down the leg side and Morgan has gloved through to the keeper! That would have been a wide had he let it go, but the pace drew him into a response, and a thin tickle does the rest! England's revival is dented by a familiar foe
on the back foot, a Test-match line, defended out to point with a flinch
lifting outside off on a fifth-stump line. Left well alone
outside off stump, no stroke offered
tossed up, tapped down the ground to long-off
tossed up again, half an appeal as a bat-pad forward defence comes into play
good line and length, circumspect defence on off stump
an expansive drive, out to deep cover
outside off, chopped to cover
on the toes, flicked to the leg side
worked to deep square leg
outside off, through to the keeper
a hint of width and an airy slap, at a catchable height through the gully, but there is no gully...
banged in short, wafted into the leg side
angled bat, deflecting a full length through third man
solid line and length, all Moeen can do is stand tall and defend his stumps
forward and defended into the off side
back of a length, hoisted to deep square leg
smothering the googly on the front foot
tries to advance but finds his way blocked by a good length
quicker and flatter, slapped back down the pitch
cut to backward point
stabbed out to cover
back of a length, dabbed to cover
over-pitched and pinged hard through the covers! Lovely strike, in the air for a while, but perfectly placed
outside off, left alone on a good length
deflected through third man
wicket to wicket, defended back to the bowler
sweet strike, leaning onto the front foot and pinged over the covers
driven into the covers
a filthy leg-side long-hop. Woakes can't cash in on the pull but England accept the extra
back on a better line, defended back to the bowler
plants the front dog, mows through the line, and that sails handsomely over the ropes at wide long-on!
forward and pushed down the ground
another calmly placed push to the man back on the long-off rope
sweet strike! Leaning onto the front foot, sumptuously timed through the covers from another boundary
back of a length, a short-arm pull through midwicket
eased down the ground with a vertical blade
punched back to the bowler who half-stops with one hand
short, pulled off the back foot to backward square leg
popped up into the leg side, all the pace taken off the ball, but there's no-one close enough to capitalise
tight line, deflected to backward point
back of a length, straightens off the deck, pushed back to the bowler
tight line once more, solid defence on the crease
outside off and drilled on the up into the covers, Travis Head slides round well on the boundary to gather
fenced to gully off the back foot
patted into the covers, more solid connection on the front foot, and up comes the 100. Veritable riches, I tell you!
defended with resolve on the back foot
back of a length, hurried into a defensive push
nudged into the leg side
slammed over midwicket! Marsh strays a fraction too short and pays the price!
good riposte, a better length, inside edge, but a good stolen single nonetheless
hauled out through midwicket, too short again and this time the left-handed Moeen is the man to cash in. A good over from England
on the back foot, another tucked single to leg
panned out to deep midwicket and picks out the fielder! A sharp double take as Head senses the rope behind him, tosses the ball back into play, and gathers at the second attempt
full and straight, dug out on the crease
tucked into the leg side to get off the mark
beats the edge
an extravagant shouldering of arms
punched through the covers! That's a lovely strike, onto the front foot, weight transferring into the ball
back of a length, a bit of an airy slap this time but finds the gap
through to the keeper, tight line
short and leg-sided
left alone with a flourish
back of a length, a simple nibble outside off, and Cummins strikes again!
edged again but this time it doesn't carry! That's because it's the slower ball - the knuckleball - and dies in front of the keeper
chipped over the covers, a full face of the bat, pushed on the up, and out of the reach of the catcher!
squirted into the covers once more
tapped to the off side
a slash and a miss
length outside off, Curran swats it into the covers
in the channel, 141kph and Curran gets across to stun it into the off side
full and the flings the hands, scythed over backward point but it lands safely for one wide of third man
arrowed into the channel, 142kph but Woakes calmly shuffles across and shoulders arms
Woakes hops into line and leaves alone once more

teasing line, draws the fretful prod, takes the edge - but doesn't carry to slip! So close for Cummins, who ends with an immaculate 4 for 24 from his 10, a metre or two short of getting his fifth with the final ball of the spell
Curran gets into line and defends
length ball on off, prodded to cover
woof, that's gone through, 138kph and it cuts through Curran, misses the edge by a whisker and then defeats Paine, deflecting off the gloves for a bye
angled in with the arm and prodded back towards mid-on
fullish length, 131kph/80mph and pushed square
bit of width and Woakes chops it down to third man for a single
tip and run into the off side, Woakes gets home at the non-striker's end
swing and a miss from Curran, standing back and aiming a force through the covers
fuller, 138kph outside off, plinked to deep cover coming across
short and a touch wide, slower delivery from Hazlewood and it's steered away past backward point
short, rising and smashed through midwicket for four! Curran gets a biscuit, shows good technique to swivel-pull his first boundary
dug in short again, rising at the body as he fences it into the leg side
starts on a length outside off and Curran guides one to third man
Woakes moves across and dabs another single behind point
pitched up and Curran shows some batting chops once again, a princely straight drive for three
on the stumps, Woakes taps it away
rising on middle and off, defended
banged in, lollipop bouncer and Woakes swats it away through square leg for one
good length outside off, runs one more to third man
full and driven, high front elbow from Curran, pierces the off side for another single
touch back of a length and jabbed into the covers
fullish, 137kph and driven crisply along the carpet to mid-off
short ball, hoicked into the leg side, it runs away from deep square leg and into the rope - fifty for Woakes, a rhubarb stick of defiance brandished in Australia's direction
full outside off, 139kph and squirted through backward point for a couple more
sliding into the pads and flicked down to fine leg... England raise the 150, to complete indifference polite applause around Adelaide Oval
length, driven on the up through the covers, into a gap for two more
full, dobbed on middle and off, driven to mid-on but without timing as the bat turned in the hands
slower delivery, but it's basically a gentle long-hop and Woakes dumps it into the crowd at deep square leg! On he cruises
pitched up and sliding in on middle, pushed back past the bowler, mid-on comes across
in the channel and patted to cover
full but drifting leg side and Curran can nurdle one square
lobbed up on off, not much turn as Woakes steers a drive through mid-off
pushed through a but quicker and Curran drops back to punch into the covers
tossed up, lots of side spin but the ball skids on and nearly castles Curran as he plays back again
flighted, full and wide and lashed away through point
tossed up on off and Woakes eases on more through the off side
short ball, rocks back outside off and slices one down to third man
length ball, Curran comes across and punches square for another single
tempter, 129kph in the channel, Woakes flails at it but doesn't connect
short-arm jabbed into the stands! That is some strike from Woakes, who is in Ribena form right now... not a terrible ball from Stoinis, slightly short but just helped over the rope at deep midwicket
on the stumps, better length and prodded back to the bowler
shovelled down the ground, short of mid-on and they scoot through
tossed up and tickled down the ground coming forwards
flighted, Curran shuffles across and pushes through cover
tossed up on off and Woakes mistimes a thump

heaved leg side, there's a man out there... but it clears Tye and goes for six! Looks like he misjudged that, Zampa thought it was going straight to the man at cow corner, but he came in a few yards and then couldn't lay a hand on it
floated up full, worked back to the bowler
pushed through and he goes back to try and cut
full, the knuckle-ball to start with, Curran gets a leading edge
pitched up on the stumps and flicked away to square leg, 'Yar!' barks Curran straight away
full length, 135kph outside off and tapped square

slower ball, slugged down the ground... and well taken by the fielder running in from long-on! Glenn Maxwell it is, on as a sub, and he's the sort of catcher you want under those. Woakes' impressive counterattack is ended, a wide legcutter from Tye does it and he picks up his second wicket
fired in straight and jabbed away to leg
good length, drops on to the back foot and guides a single to third man
floated up and driven through mid-off for one
flighted, outside off and gripping a touch, comes off the edge and runs wide of the keeper
pushed through on the stumps, nudged away to the leg side
slower, looped up on off, stroked down the ground for one
tossed up and worked into a gap
oh, nearly a caught-and-bowled! Mistimed jab back down the ground and it burst through the hands with Zampa in his follow through
short ball, whumped over wide long-on for six! Clean swing of the bat from Curran and it goes all the way
comes across and defends
taking the pace off, angled in on the stumps and tapped away
full, room for Curran to free the arms and he crashes a drive to the cover boundary - four more!

gone! Tye finishes it with the knuckle-ball, ending Curran's sally with a mistimed chip to midwicket. A cheeky thirty at a run a ball helping England to respectability, but almost certainly not enough
good line! Tight to off stump, a hint of curl away from the left-hander, half a yard fuller and the edge comes into play...
strides forward, nudged into the leg side
big stride, slapped through the covers, Warner's up and away! England needed 15 overs to reach the rope...
stabbed to mid-on
back of a length, Warner climbs into a pull and under-edges over the top of his stumps! Lucky, lucky...
tight line to finish, and a calm leave
very full, wide of off stump, a hint of shape back into the left-hander, who leaves alone
lovely bowling! Fast, full, nip off the seam, raps the pad but that was probably too high to justify an appeal
wider line, angled across the batsman, through to the keeper
back of a length, very firmly into line to defend
defended on the back foot, good bouncing bomb of a delivery, wicket to wicket line
short and fierce, but too short for the square-leg umpire's liking
tapped to mid-off, and a fine quick single
outside off, slapped off the back foot to cover
drilled through the covers, a fraction too full and Woakes pays the price
better line, tighter to off, and full length too. No stroke this time
good line again, Through to the keeper with good carry and a touch of late movement back into the batsman
forward, pushed to cover
onto the front foot, thumped to cover
back of a length, slapped out through the leg side
urgently punched off the back foot, to cover
tucked to the leg side
change of angle, bringing the ball back into the pads, and Head inside-edges a defensive drive into his legs
too short from Wood, and Head is deep in his crease, ready to pounce on the err in length. Fiercely slammed through midwicket!
tucked off the hip, gathered on the boundary's edge
spanked off the front foot, clean through midwicket! Just too short from Woakes, and mercilessly punished!
full and straight, attacking the stumps and fended off with a loud 'no!'
full this time, met with a full face too, pushed back down the pitch
edged and gone! Perfect line and length, a hint of seam, Warner pushes with hard hands and Buttler does the rest!
forward, and left alone on a good length. More good carry to the keeper
calmly poked into the covers to get the feel of bat on ball
spanked on the up, and over the covers! Too much width, a chance to free the hands, and clubbed to the boundary
edged and wide of slip! Wood has just vacated his second slip, and that would have been gobbled. Instead, it's runs
whipped through leg from wide of off stump, in the air for a moment, but wide of the field, and this is a leaky over
outside off, swinging past the stumps
on the back foot, defended to the off side
solidly onto the front foot
on the toes, clipped hard to deep mid-on.
back of a length, and utterly panned through mid-on! It wasn't especially short, but he's set up so deep in the crease, and is primed to pounce on any length
rising delivery, pushed into the off side
short, slapped, down into the ground and that's an excellent half-stop by a leaping point, intercepts a certain four
good ball, beaten outside off stump
crashed through the covers! Full length, and Head cashes in. He's nailing it today...
full length, curling into the pads, worked to the leg side
outside off, through to the keeper
fully forward, stabbed to the off side
inswinger and that's plumb! Curling into the front pad, White attempts to play across the line but the ball beats him to it. Up goes the finger, and England are still brawling
through to the keeper, wide of off stump
driven into the covers and that's a wicket maiden to launch his spell. That is very much what the doctor ordered for England's flatlining hopes in this game...
round the wicket, full length, worked to midwicket
on the back foot, forced into the covers but can't beat the field
flicked around the front pad, out to square leg
on the back foot, inside-edged out to square leg
worked to point
on the front foot, nudged round the corner to the leg side
urgh... that's a horrid double-bouncing wide, outside off, and dribbling to the keeper. Attempted back-of-the-hander, but it went awry
and again! Very fancy-pants, but that isn't going to help the cause. Barely touches the cut strip
thumped down the ground! Over-pitched as Curran strains for his length, and met with a crushingly straight blade
full, straight, poked into the covers
better length, straight and swinging, and just too short to drive. Squirted uncertainly into the covers
full-length outswinger, met under the eyeline and drilled to midwicket
on the pads, flicked on the up to the leg side
stretching for the width, and slapped through the covers! Head is seeing it like a melon today
good line and length
attacking the stumps, solid defence
glided into the gap at short midwicket
drawn down the track, Moeen holds it back, and forces a late adjusted push to cover
on the pads, calmly flicked to midwicket
round the wicket, dabbed behind point for a simple single
good wicket to wicket line, a slider to start, tapped back to the bowler
a bottom-handed whip out to deep midwicket
drawn onto the front foot, and defended with a full face into the off side
closes the face as he stretches onto the front foot, meeting the wrong'un with a poke to midwicket
tossed up outside off, a loose inside-edged slash through to square leg. Didn't pick the googly that time
rising onto the toes, punched back down the pitch
pushed out to cover
eased behind square
tucked round the corner
stabbed into the covers
sliding into line to defend back down the track
very full, dipping onto the toes, and clipped to mid-on
on the back foot, eased down to long-on
held back in the flight, and turns from just back of a length, worked out to cover
tossed up, and Smith misses out with a loose wallop. Careful skipper...
googly, met on the back foot and pushed out to cover

back of a length, Smith slashes hard and that's a brilliant sharp take at slip! it was travelling quickly but Root watched that right off the blade, rode with the pace and swallowed the chance to his right to keep the pressure on Australia...
forward, looped up and dipping late, eased to cover
forward and pushed to cover
leaning onto the front foot once more
back of a length, punched back to the bowler
tossed up, and that's well struck through the covers, half-stopped with a dive and tidied up with a chase from mid-off
forward and pushed into the covers
into line to defend
too short, a hint of turn and Marsh pounds that through point! More of a square drive than a cut, utterly nailed off the face of the bat
played it late, and pounded down the ground!
worked into the covers
leaning onto the front foot, doesn't quite pick the wrong'un and that nearly sneaks through the gate! Inside-edged to midwicket
too short that time, but Marsh plays it too well, timed to perfection to the cover sweeper
swished down the ground, gathered by the bowler
on the toes, a loose ball, eased with the (lack of) spin out to midwicket
crunched! That was tossed up, well wide of the stumps, but Marsh utterly mullered that through the covers, down on one knee to add to the impact
so close! Sliding through and Buttler half-appeals thinking there might have been a graze on that one
bunted to mid-on
a big wind-up but can't beat the man at mid-on
once again, swinging hard through the line but Moeen protects his figures
clubbed out to deep point
shuffling feet, worked firmly into the covers
another googly, and Marsh once again fails to pick it with a tentative front-foot prod
more confidently forward this time, leaning into the defensive push
high and mighty! Right underneath the ball, battered high, high into the sky, and with plenty legs to clear cow corner!
nudged to the leg side, and that will be drinks
filthy delivery from Moeen, short and bunged down the leg side and Marsh clatters it to fine leg for four
darted on the stumps, punched to mid-on standing tall
tossed up, but more air and MMarsh nearly gets in a tangle attempting a lap sweep, the top edge loops in front of short third man
pushed through outside off and Marsh belts it through the covers for one more - Australia notch the 100

round the wicket, dollied up on the pads and flicked uppishly, shout of 'catch!' from Moeen but it lands safely and brings Head his fifty - he's played well, after a couple of sticky innings in the middle order
flat delivery on off, tapped away
floated up from over the wicket, outside off and Head leans into a crisp punch past cover for four - raises 1000 runs in ODI cricket, too
tossed up and pushed towards cover
flighted, comes forward and plays back to the bowler
ooh, nearly sneaks it through! Fizzes down the legbreak and Head is a bit late on it, hammed down into his boots
flighted, spinning in as he goes back and tries to cut
pushed through, dipping with overspin and Head watchfully defends on off
floated up outside off and Marsh belabours a vengeful drive through the covers to the sweeper
round the wicket, lobbed up on off and pushed away
tossed up and worked back down the ground for one
slung down in the corridor outside off and Marsh crunches another drive for one
angled in with the arm, knocked back toward the bowler
looped up and tapped into the ring again
flighted, spinning away outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
pushed through, straightening on leg stump and worked for one off the pads
slows the pace up, full outside off and punched for one
dragged down a touch and Head sits on the back foot, clubs in front of point

full toss - but he's flubbed it straight back to the bowler! Rashid shakes his head, acknowledging his luck; he did well to cling on, actually, as it was struck pretty hard. Marsh can't believe it but it's gifted England another opening
tossed up and Stoinis isn't going to die in a hole, swings the forearms and belts his first ball over mid-on for four
dug in short, doesn't get up all that much, 128kph to start with and Head has to get low to duck it
full around off stump and driven without timing to mid-off
length on the pads, chipped a little airily but it lands short of mid-on
short ball, 137kph and Head jumps across to defend
dug in again but this is powder-puff stuff and Head rocks on to the back foot to club four through midwicket
gets it up there, 141kph around off, punched to mid-off
over the wicket, floated up and defended watchfully on off stump
pushed through, Stoinis gets across and blocks
touch short and he goes back and cuts one through point to get off strike
length ball, Head flicks off his pads, almost a miscue to midwicket but it lands safely
slips out a full toss, think it was the wrong'un but Head doesn't worry about which way it will turn by swatting it behind square on the full, a misfield helps them to two
tossed up and worked through backward square leg with the turn
angled across Head, who steers a couple through backward point
dug in short, Head whirls on a pull, seemed to lose sight of it but picks up one to deep midwicket
short and rising over off stump, shows it the maker's name
oof, that's a good nut, 140 clicks and slipping past the outside edge as Stoinis misjudges the line
does him again, slippery stuff from Wood, this time Stoinis trying to force it off the back foot
banged in at the body, pulled firmly away to fine leg
tossed up and Stoinis clouts the ball through square leg for a brisk boundary. Releases the pressure
flighted, outside off but Stoinis goes leg side again, plays the sweep well, in control and guided to deep backward square

tossed up and slogged into the off side, taken! Stoinis completely undoes the good work of the previous two balls but hoicking an ugly top edge straight up, barely made it to the edge of the ring and Roy grabs it safely
flighted on middle and leg, worked back down the ground
floated up on the stumps, Paine gets into line
gives it some air and Paine drives but sends it skimming to extra cover
fullish length, sliding across and sliced to backward point
short, flicked off the hip, the ball trickles behind square on the leg side and they trot through
length, sharp pace and rising over off stump, defended
full, 142kph but steered with control in front of the dive of point, one into the deep
back of a length, Head flashes and flashes hard, just out of the reach of backward point and it flies to the fence!
tighter line, 138kph/86mph and defended down into the off side
lobbed up outside off and Paine neatly dabs the ball in front of mid-off to scamper through
full and straightening a touch outside off, Head blocks on the back foot
pushed through and worked wit the spin the midwicket
floated up, dipping on off as Head drives but picks out cover
slow and loopy, low full toss on the pads and it's whipped away to deep midwicket for one
pushed through a touch quicker outside off and Paine again plays softly, running the ball away square for a single
floated up outside off, Paine tickles it along the green to mid-off
pushed through straighter and worked to the on side
fizzed down around off stump and punched through the covers coming forwards
quicker ball, guided off the back foot and he gets it fine of short third man, they run hard and Paine gets back as Buttler collects and breaks the bails
pushed through outside off and glided off the face for a single
calculated assault from Head, skips down and clears mid-on with a well-struck lofted drive, bounces away to the rope to calm Aussie nerves
tossed up and driven, snapped up in the covers
shouts of 'catch', was that an edge? Buttler didn't take it cleanly and then tried to whip off the bails but Paine had his foot in
floated up and Paine throws the bat, slapped uppishly past the cover catcher, mid-off prevents a run
defended coming forwards
tossed up and worked through mid-on, Head has to hurry but makes it to the striker's end
floated up on the stumps and nudged into a gap
full toss, that's going to be a no-ball on height... slugged over the leg side for a boundary, as well
full on off, punched down the ground
darted on off stump, Paine taps it away
angled in on middle and off stump, clipped through mid-on
tossed up from round the wicket and Head nurdles another single to long-on
gives this a bit more air and Paine aims a drive but fails to get bat on ball
flat outside off and steered towards short third man
back of a length, angled across from over the wicket and dropped square on the off side
length ball, 135kph and Head drives, the ball bobbles back to the bowler
in the channel, not enough room to free the arms and he can only punch to backward point again
pitched up and driven, gets it between mid-off and extra cover for one
on the stumps and worked for a single
short and wide and clattered to the rope at backward point, a no-nonsense biff from Head and he moves into the 90s
goes round the wicket, 138kph and banged n short, wheeled down to fine leg on the pull
low full toss from Wood, bunted towards mid-on where Morgan does well to get a hand on it and prevent four
dug in, 138kph/86mph but Paine rolls his wrists on it and they get one more to fine leg
in the channel outside off and glided down to third man
full, jammed into the ground and Head calls him through, Wood races after it and side-foots towards the stumps but to no avail
another bumper but Adelaide deck has gone to sleep, Head knows his way around this place and swats it for one more
short ball, sliding across Head who tries to cut but only manages a thick bottom edge
more short stuff, Head hammers a pull to the man at deep square leg, just a single
full length, 139kph but clipped off the toes to mid-on
banged in, tepid bumper and Paine swivels on a pull for one
slanted across, slower delivery from Woakes, Head sits in the crease and glides one more to third man
back of a length and tapped back down the track

oh no! Head has pulled to mid-on! Four runs short of a deserved century, he's failed to get on top of the bounce and sent a straightforward catch straight to Morgan. Head heads off with his head bowed in disappointment, but he can hold his, er, head high after guiding the chase
length outside off, 138kph and stabbed towards point
touch short in the channel and Cummins gets this away down to third man for one
round the wicket, dug in short and Paine swivels to send it safely down to fine leg
short outside off, 138kph/86mph and Cummins drops the hands
banged in short, a pull off the eyebrows, to backward square
opens the face to guide a single into the covers
punched hard off the back foot, and well grabbed with one hand at backward point
short, Cummins sways inside the line
slightly wide outside off, Cummins pokes with flat feet
outside off, and tapped through to third man

full length, clipped down to long-on and there's a huge mix-up! How on earth did that happen? Cummins turned blind for the second, his partner was going nowhere, and rightly so, as the shy came in, Wood gathered and flicked off the bails, and ... well ... jitters! EDIT: There would have been two if Paine had pushed the first one ... he'll know he was at fault
a sharp bouncer, and swayed inside the line
short and wide, that will help no end!
swivel-pulled through backward square, and suddenly that pressure, on Australia and Paine himself, has evaporated!
spanked out to square leg, can't beat the field, but a comfortable single
drilled down the ground and Australia win by three wickets! They made hard work of a game that they basically had in the bag after 6.2 overs, but they've avoided the whitewash
